intro: Hieracium marginale, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, and it blooms from June to August. Hieracium marginale is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
